metadata.title: CVE-2024-44070 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in FRRouting (FRR) through 10.1. bgp_attr_encap inbgpd/bgp_attr.c does not check the actual remaining stream length beforetaking the TLV value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-44070` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

quagga - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
quagga-bgpd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
quagga-core - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
quagga-isisd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
quagga-ospf6d - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
quagga-ospfd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
quagga-pimd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
quagga-ripd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
quagga-ripngd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
quagga package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-4ubuntu0.5').
